extendedIngredients.name: vinegar
extendedIngredients.original: 2 teaspoons vinegar (such as cider or Champagne)

title: Chilled Beets with Sour Cream
summary: Chilled Beets with Sour Cream might be just the side dish you are searching for. Watching your figure? This gluten free, primal, and vegetarian recipe has 93 calories, 2g of protein, and 6g of fat per serving. For 62 cents per serving, this recipe covers 4% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 6. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. If you have beets, cream, olive oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 22%. This score is rather bad. Similar recipes are Roasted Beets with Sour Cream, Tagliatelle with Shredded Beets, Sour Cream, and Parsley, and Arctic Char with Horseradish Cream, Sweet-and-Sour Beets, and Dandelion Greens.
instructions: Place the beets and 1 tablespoon of the salt in a large pot and add enough cold water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook until a paring knife can be inserted smoothly into a beet, about 25 minutes, depending on size. Drain and rinse under cold running water until cool enough to handle. Remove the skins. (They should slip off easily, another sign of doneness.) Place the beets in a bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Slice them in half lengthwise. Arrange the halves on 6 serving plates. Drizzle with the oil and vinegar, then sprinkle with the remaining salt and the pepper. Serve with a dollop of sour cream on the side and some snipped dill.Tip: Look for beets in an array of colors at your local farmers' market. Candy cane (pictured) is a relatively common variety with red and white stripes.

steps.step: Place the beets and 1 tablespoon of the salt in a large pot and add enough cold water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook until a paring knife can be inserted smoothly into a beet, about 25 minutes, depending on size.
Drain and rinse under cold running water until cool enough to handle.
Remove the skins. (They should slip off easily, another sign of doneness.)
Place the beets in a bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Slice them in half lengthwise. Arrange the halves on 6 serving plates.
Drizzle with the oil and vinegar, then sprinkle with the remaining salt and the pepper.

Serve with a dollop of sour cream on the side and some snipped dill.Tip: Look for beets in an array of colors at your local farmers' market. Candy cane (pictured) is a relatively common variety with red and white stripes.
